title: Governor Kemp Signs Religious Freedom Restoration Act
summary:
# Georgia Legislature Session Summary

## Overview
Governor Brian Kemp signed Senate Bill 36, the Religious Freedom Restoration Act, into law on the final day of the legislative session. The bill aims to protect the religious freedom of Georgians, though critics argue it could allow for discrimination against marginalized groups.

## Key Actions
**SB 36**: Religious Freedom Restoration Act

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
None noted.

## Notable Moments
Governor Kemp emphasized that despite signing the religious freedom bill, Georgia remains a state that has "no place for hate" and assured all Georgians of this.

## Votes
No recorded votes detected.

## Attendance
Quorum was present for the governor's signing of the bill.

## Adjournment
The session adjourned after the governor's signing of SB 36. The next legislative session was not specified.
transcript:
Governor Brian Kemp kicked off the final
day of the legislative session by
signing Senate Bill 36 into law,
ensuring that once again at the state
level that Georgians are protected,
including Georgians of faith. And I
wanted to let everybody know that
despite signing that legislation,
Georgia still remains a state that is a
state that there's no place for hate.
And I can assure all Georgians of that
today. The law bans the government from
interfering with a person's exercise of
religion. Critics of SB36 say it allows
people to use religion as an excuse to
discriminate against marginalized
groups.
